definition: to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct

sentences.english: We should stress emphasis on quake drills and the structure of buildings on ordinary days.
sentences.chinese: 我們平時應注意防震演習和建物的結構。

sentences.english: How can a building sink into the ground?
sentences.chinese: 建物如何纔會下陷地裏？

sentences.english: Kahn's siting of the building reasserts the spatial and topographical order of the site.
sentences.chinese: 康爲建物的選址再次主張了基地內空間及地形的道。

sentences.english: On their last visit they pushed the structure over on its side.
sentences.chinese: 在最後一次視察時他們把整座建物給推倒在一旁。

sentences.english: Many people were entombed in the rubble of the bombed buildings.
sentences.chinese: 很多人被埋在炸燬的建物的瓦礫裏。

definition: Taibei or Taipei, capital of Taiwan
Ginkakuji or Silver pavilion in northeast Kyōto 京都, Japan/officially called Jishōji 慈照寺[Ci2 zhao4 si4]
Nuannuan district of Keelung City 基隆市[Ji1 long2 shi4], Taiwan
Muzha (old spelling: Mucha), suburb to the southeast of Taipei
Shilin or Shihlin district of Taipei City 臺北市|台北市[Tai2 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
Xinyi or Hsinyi district of Taipei City 臺北市|台北市[Tai2 bei3 shi4], Taiwan/Hsini district of Keelung City 基隆市[Ji1 long2 shi4], Taiwan
